answers.answer: sorry it just gets worse apart from you probs will stop feeling so sick or nauseous you will start aching being sore when you get further on when the baby moves it kinda hurts aswell the baby gets under those ribs n u crnt breath you body hurts you just need to ly dow all the time trust me i thought when you got to qa certaqin part in your pregnancy you get a energy burst but i havnt with this pregnacy ive felt the same tired, sick. im 39 weeks tomorrow so i shudnt really be pregnant anymore than 2 more weeks  n i will have my beautiful baby n ill b able to bend again lol

This isn't my first rodeo lol. By 16 weeks with my son, I felt fine. I had hyperemesis till I was 14 weeks, and then got hit with gestational diabetes at 15 weeks. Once my sugar was under control, I felt great. He screened me early for diabetes again, and he said I did better on this test than I did on my glucose test after having my son. The last two weeks of this pregnancy has been difficult. I'm struggling to gain weight (I gained 6 pounds at the beginning from my constantly eating). I'm so tired of Zofran and Phernegan, and I can tell they aren't working as well. I'm ready to not feel sick all the time!

I didn't start to feel better til almost 19 weeks ( my morning sickness was from 9 weeks -18 1/2 weeks )since then I have been pretty much okay ( 29 weeks 4 days now ) I still the occasional headache and won't eat certain foods , sour cream being one I just can't eat . Hopefully you feel better soon :)

Mine wore off with last pregnancy about 22 weeks. :) You'll be okay! Just eat as much as you can, avoid foods that trigger sickness, lots of water.Have you been tested for anemia? you could be low on iron. xx

Not yet. I go back in two weeks. They are worried about my blood sugar, and with good reason. I woke up from a 45 minute nap today, and I felt like I had the stomach bug. My doctor gave me Ambien cuz I'm only sleeping 2 hours at night. He told me to take Zantac because it sounded like acid making me so sick, but I haven't felt a huge difference. I feel worse than I did at 8 weeks. I'm waiting on my Phernegan to kick in so I can get situated in bed. It's pretty bad when the motion of laying down makes you sick.

question: When did everyone start feeling human again? I'll be 17 weeks Sunday, and I still feel nauseous, weak, and extremely exhausted.
title: when did you start feeling better
